org.mozilla.gecko

Class TextInputController

  • Object
    • org.mozilla.gecko.TextInputController

  • public final class TextInputController
extends Object
    TextInputController handles text input for GeckoSession through key events or input methods. It is typically used to implement certain methods in View such as onCreateInputConnection(), by forwarding such calls to corresponding methods in TextInputController.

    • Method Detail

      • getHandler

        @NonNull
public android.os.Handler getHandler(@NonNull
                                              android.os.Handler defHandler)
        Get a Handler for the background input method thread. In order to use a background thread for input method operations on systems prior to Nougat, first override View.getHandler() for the View returning the InputConnection instance, and then call this method from the overridden method. For example:
         @Override
 public Handler getHandler() {
     if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= 24) {
         return super.getHandler();
     }
     return getSession().getTextInputController().getHandler(super.getHandler());
 }
        Parameters:
        defHandler - Handler returned by the system getHandler implementation.
        Returns:
        Handler to return to the system through getHandler.

      • getView

        @Nullable
public android.view.View getView()
        Get the current View for text input.
        Returns:
        Current text input View or null if not set.
        See Also:
        setView(View)

      • setView

        public void setView(@Nullable
                    android.view.View view)
        Set the View for text input. The current View is used to interact with the system input method manager and to display certain text input UI elements.
        Parameters:
        view - Text input View or null to clear current View.

      • onCreateInputConnection

        @Nullable
public android.view.inputmethod.InputConnection onCreateInputConnection(@NonNull
                                                                                  android.view.inputmethod.EditorInfo attrs)
        Get an InputConnection instance. For full functionality, call setView(View) first before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        attrs - EditorInfo instance to be filled on return.
        Returns:
        InputConnection instance or null if input method is not active.

        Parameters:

        event - KeyEvent instance.
        Returns:
        True if the event was handled.

      • isInputActive

        public boolean isInputActive()
